Articles.Content: This is probably a sensitive topic, but is it permissible to put monetary bounties on mod requests?

I don't think anyone here can stop you from offering money to mod makers. Plenty of mod makers also have donation buttons, though none of that entitles you to get anything from them. That said, I doubt it's worth it -- paying a developer's salary multiplied by the amount of time required would get pretty expensive (and since they probably can't drop everything and work on the mod anyway, it's not like the work would get done faster than it is already), and offering a substantially lower amount would be insulting (for some interesting real-world examples of undersized financial incentives having the opposite intended effect, check out Freakonomics).

You're probably better off trying to convince other mod makers and users that we want the same things that you want. Then it will happen. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
